g.H3526: to trample; hence, to wash (properly, by stamping with the feet), whether literal (including the fulling process) or figurative
g.H853: properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)
g.H7167: to rend, literally or figuratively (revile, paint the eyes, as if enlarging them)
g.H4480: properly, a part of; hence (prepositionally), from or out of in many senses
g.H899: a covering, i.e. clothing; also treachery or pillage
g.H5785: skin (as naked); by implication, hide, leather
g.H176: desire (and so probably in Proverbs 31:4); hence (by way of alternative) or, also if
g.H8359: a fixture, i.e. the warp in weaving
g.H6154: the web (or transverse threads of cloth); also a mixture, (or mongrel race)

g.H518: used very widely as demonstrative, lo!; interrogative, whether?; or conditional, if, although; also Oh that!, when; hence, as a negative, not
g.H7200: to see, literally or figuratively (in numerous applications, direct and implied, transitive, intransitive and causative)

g.H5061: a blow (figuratively, infliction); also (by implication) a spot (concretely, a leprous person or dress)
